chargeHist.descr: 2nd Deg. Sex. Assault by Correct. Staff

result.execSummary:
The defendant Xavier D Thicklen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Xavier D Thicklen is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Xavier D Thicklen was found guilty of Misconduct/Office-Act/Excess Authority, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.12(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: 01-26-2015; extension to pay fine granted by the court.  Defendant ordered to pay $25.00 per month until paid in full-not to miss payments or balance due and civil judgment  to take effect.

Consecutive to any other sentence.
Consecutive to: any other sentence

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Order granting an extension received and field.  Court orders defendant to pay fine, costs and surcharges at the rate of $25 per month commencing 2-16-15.  If any payment is more than 10 days late, the balance is due immediately and the alternative takes effect./ds
Per order of the Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. Daniel L. Konkol, Br. 44, for review. mag
Defendant's pro se request for payment plan.
CHANGE OF PLEA/ SENTENCING

AS TO AMENDED COUNT 1:  Defendant waived rights and pled NO CONTEST.  Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for a guilty plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the amended information.  Judgment of Conviction entered.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements made by counsel, the defendant and the court.  The Court ordered the Defendant to serve 3 days in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 3 days time served.   You may not possess a firearm at any time in the future - sec. 941.29 Wis. Stats. makes it another felony for anyone who has been convicted of a felony to ever possess a firearm, carrying with it its own 10 year period of imprisonment or $25,000 fine or both.  You cannot vote in any election until your civil rights are restored.  973.176(2).  You are required to provide a DNA sample to the State Crime Lab. 973.046 & 973.047.  COURT ORDERS defendant to pay a fine of $200 plus costs, victim witness surcharges and penalty assessments by 1-26-2015.  If defendant fails to pay the monetary amounts on time, then the entire balance becomes due immediately and a judgment will be entered against the defendant and collection can proceed under sec. 71.935 of the Stats. as well as other collection procedures.  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.  Court vacated 12-1-2014 jury trial.

Defendant Xavier D Thicklen in court with attorney Lew A Wasserman.  Paul L. Tiffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Amended Information received and filed, charging: COUNT 1:  MISCONDUCT IN PUBIC OFFICE (ACT IN EXCESS OF LAWFUL AUTHORITY), contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 946.12(2), 939.50(3)(i), a Class I Felony.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.
to File an Amended Information to Which the Defendant Will Plead Guilty and Amended Information, received and filed.
Original Transcript PRELIMINARY HEARING (51 pages) commencing FEBRUARY 13, 2014 received and filed.

Defendant Xavier D Thicklen in court with attorney Lew A Wasserman.  Paul L. Tiffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Attorney Wasserman may withdraw on this case, but is willing to set it for final pretrial and jury trial today.  Final pre-trial scheduled for November 26, 2014 at 09:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for December 1, 2014 at 09:00 am.
Original Transcript MOTION HEARING  (10 pages) commencing OCTOBER 1, 2014 received and filed.

Defendant Xavier D Thicklen in court with attorney Lew A Wasserman.  Paul L. Tiffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Defense moves for an adjournment.  Statements by counsel.  For the reasons stated on the record, Court adjourns the case for pretrial.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 28, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Xavier D Thicklen in court with attorney Lew A Wasserman.  Paul L. Tiffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Hearing on motion proceeds.  Arguments by counsel.  Court finds the district attorney has no obligation to engage in negotiations, the district attorney is not representing any party in any lawsuit and has no duty to recuse himself.  Court denies defense motion.

Motion to Compel Plea Bargaining and Motion to Recuse District Attorney and Appendix to Motion to Compel Plea Bargaining and Motion to Recuse District Attorney received and filed.  Case set for 10-1-14 at 10:00 a.m., Br. 44.

Defendant Xavier D Thicklen in court with attorney Lew A Wasserman.  Paul L. Tiffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Final pretrial held in chambers.   Case remains set for jury trial.
Defendant's Witness List received and filed./ds
State's Requested Jury Instructions received and filed./ds
State's Witness List received and filed./ds
Defense has not filed any motions.  Case is removed from the calendar.  Case remains set for final pretrial./ds

Defendant Xavier D Thicklen in court with attorney Lewis A Wasserman.  Paul L Tiffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy Court Clerk kmh.
Case scheduled for final pretrial.  Defense and state are requesting an adjournment of the trial due to the length of the discovery.  Court vacated the jury trial date of 7/21/2014.  Parties are advised as of August 1, 2014 this matter will be reassigned to Judge Konkol, Br 44 in room 506 of the Safety Building.    Case set for final pretrial on 9/29/2014  at 8:30 am.  Jury trial set for 10/06/2014  at 9:00am. Scheduling order signed and filed.   All motions due by 7/21/2014.  Case adjourned to Br 44.  Motion hearing scheduled for 09-19-2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Xavier D Thicklen in court with attorney Lewis A Wasserman.  Paul L Tiffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy Court Clerk kmh.
Case scheduled for motion.  Letter with attachments from defense received and filed.  State has provided defense with CD today.  Parties will notify the court if there are any other issues.  Case remains scheduled for final pretrial on 6/19/2014 at 8:30 a.m. and jury trial on 7/21/2014 at 8:30 a.m. in Br 12. Case adjourned to Br 12.

Defendant Xavier D Thicklen in court with attorney Lewis A Wasserman.  Miriam Falk for Paul L. Tiffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case scheduled for Status Conference. 
Defense states discovery has been received and addresses motions to be filed. 
Any motions by the Defense to be filed by 4-15-14 and any reply by the state to be filed by 5-15-14. 
Case is adjourned for Motion Hearing, Br. 12.  Motion hearing scheduled for May 29, 2014 at 03:00 pm.  
Final pre-trial scheduled for June 19, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for July 21, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Xavier D Thicklen in court with attorney Jean Keis for attorney Lewis A. Wasserman.  Paul L. Tiffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Wasserman is ill and not in court today. Case adjourned for Status in Br. 12.  Status conference scheduled for March 12, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defense's First Demand for Discovery and Inspection Pursuant to Wis. Stat. 971.23 is received and filed.

Defendant Xavier D Thicklen in court with attorney Lewis A Wasserman.  Paul L Tiffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Upon oral motion by the State, Court amends the criminal complaint to reflect the correction of  the date "December 3, 2013" on pages (2) and (3).  Sworn for the state:Donald Desotell-MCSD Detective. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court. Court enters a not guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.  Case is adjourned to Branch 12.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 4, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with SLM.

Defendant Xavier D Thicklen in court with attorney Lewis A Wasserman.  Carole R Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy Court Clerk: TC.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Borwoski, Branch 12.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.   Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 13, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 2/5/14 @ 1:30pm
